required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Recovery After Electroconvulsive Therapy and General Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Recovery After Electroconvulsive Therapy and General Anesthesia Reconstitution of Consciousness and Cognition (Phase 2)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is geared toward characterizing the recovery of brain activity and cognitive function following treatments of electroconvulsive therapy and ketamine general anesthesia.

detailed_description.textblock:
Seizures are often associated with loss of consciousness, possibly through effects on sub-cortical arousal systems, disruption of cortical-subcortical interactions, and ultimately through depressed neocortical function. Furthermore, people are often confused in the post-ictal state even when consciousness returns after a seizure. Disrupted cognitive function during the postictal phase has not been fully characterized but presents short and long-term implications. Many experience an acute disorder of attention, consciousness, and cognition, referred to as delirium. Memory deficits are also common. The neurobiology for these phenomena are incomplete and challenging to test, as seizures are typically sporadic and vary in intensity and character. In contrast, the setting of electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) provides the opportunity to study the reconstitution of consciousness and cognition following seizures in an elective and predictable context.
There is no standard agent used to induce general anesthesia during ECT. Ketamine is receiving greater attention as an infusion for treating depression and for its potential benefits on improving ECT efficacy and expediting cognitive recovery. Further data are needed to determine whether ketamine may improve recovery of cognitive function relative to etomidate, a commonly used anesthetic for general anesthesia during ECT.
The investigators will evaluate the cognition function and electroencephalographic patterns that accompany the recovery from ECT and general anesthesia. Twenty patients with refractory depression will be randomized in this interventional single-blinded randomized crossover trial. Each patient will complete seven study visits. The first visit will be conducted during the dose-charge titration ECT treatment with etomidate anesthesia. After this session, patients will be randomized to three sessions each week for two weeks (six treatments total). Over the first week patients will be randomized in order for three treatment arms: (1) etomidate general anesthesia and ECT, (2) ketamine general anesthesia and ECT, and (3) ketamine alone. Patients will be blinded to the treatment arm for each session. Baseline and post-treatment measurements of cognition and ECT will be acquired on each of the six treatment sessions.
Patients that agree will have a MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive Function During Recovery: Rate of Recovery
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 30, 60, 90, 120 minutes following return of consciousness, assessed on treatment days 1-6.
primary_outcome.description: A cognitive test battery was administered at 0, 30, 60, 90, and 120 minutes following return of consciousness after general anesthesia on each treatment day (1-6). The data from each treatment day (1-6) were averaged for analyses. Cognition Test Battery: Psychomotor Vigilance Task (PVT) Digital Symbol Substitution Task (DSST) Motor Praxis Task (MP) Visual Object Learning Task (VOLT) Abstract Matching (AM) Rate of Recovery for this measure is defined as the time (in inverse hours) for participants to return to their baseline performance for each task.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive Function During Recovery: Initial Decrement
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 30, 60, 90, 120 minutes following return of consciousness, assessed on treatment days 1-6.
primary_outcome.description: A cognitive test battery was administered at 0, 30, 60, 90, and 120 minutes following return of consciousness after general anesthesia on each treatment day (1-6). The data from each treatment day (1-6) were averaged for analyses. Cognition Test Battery: Psychomotor Vigilance Task (PVT) Digital Symbol Substitution Task (DSST) Motor Praxis Task (MP) Visual Object Learning Task (VOLT) Abstract Matching (AM) Initial Decrement for this measure is defined as the difference between response times (in seconds) at baseline and t=0 for each task.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following return of consciousness (t=0) during treatment days 1-6.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using 3D Confusion Assessment Method (CAM). The groups/arms for this outcome are separated by anesthetic regimen; however, due to the crossover design of this study all participants are included in analyses for each group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed at baseline on treatment days 1-6.
secondary_outcome.description: The groups/arms for this outcome are combined as a whole-group analysis due to the crossover design of this study, as pre-specified by the study protocol. Breaking up the analyses into the various arms of the study would change our scientific questions and approach. All participants included in analyses completed all treatments, the various arms for the study vary only in the order in which participants received each treatment. These data show the change in suicidality from baseline to treatment 6 based on the Scale of Suicide Ideation. The measure completed was the Scale of Suicide Ideation. For this study, participants completed the following questions of the questionnaire: wish to live (0 Moderate to Strong, 1 Weak, 2 None) wish to die (0 None, 1 Weak, 2 Moderate to Strong) The total scores range from 0-4. Lower scores indicate high suicide ideation, and high scores indicate low suicide ideation.
Duration (in seconds) of seizure induced by ECT treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First ECT treatment session during Treatment Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: The electrical dose necessary for seizure induction is determined during a dose-charge titration session prior to participant randomization and session 1. These results report the average electrical dose across all participants for the first treatment session during Treatment Week 1. The range for these data is 0 - 100% electrical charge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Assessment of Whether ECT Was Performed, Determined by Asking the Patient.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 120 minutes after return of responsiveness on treatment days 1-6
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient blinding of treatment performed, the patient will be asked: "Based on how you feel, did you have ECT today?" Results indicate participants correctly answering the subjective assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mood Assessed Using the Mood Self-Assessment Manikin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 120 minutes after return of responsiveness, assessed on treatment days 1-6
secondary_outcome.description: Mood Self-Assessment Manikin (SAM) Scale: 1 (very unpleasant) - 9 (very pleasant). The groups/arms for this outcome are combined as a whole-group analysis due to the Crossover design of this study, as pre-specified by the study protocol. Breaking up the analyses into the various arms of the study would change our scientific questions and approach. Further, any statistical analyses would be underpowered due to low participant numbers in each arm. Thus, the results are combined and reported as a whole group analysis. All participants included in analyses completed all treatments included in the study, the various arms for the study vary only in the order in which participants received each treatment. These data show the change in mood from baseline to treatment 6 based on the SAM. Additionally, data collected at baseline are not dependent on the study group/arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change in Mood Based on the Depression PROMIS-CAT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 120 minutes after return of responsiveness, assessed on treatment days 1-6
secondary_outcome.description: PROMIS-CAT (Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System-Computer Adaptive Testing) for depression The groups/arms for this outcome are combined as a whole-group analysis due to the Crossover design of this study, as pre-specified by the study protocol. Breaking up the analyses into the various arms of the study would change our scientific questions and approach. Further, any statistical analyses would be underpowered due to low participant numbers in each arm. Thus, the results are combined and reported as a whole group analysis. All participants included in analyses completed all treatments included in the study, the various arms for the study vary only in the order in which participants received each treatment. These data show the change in mood from baseline to treatment 6 based on the PROMIS-CAT. Additionally, data collected at baseline are not dependent on the study group/arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Delta Band (0.5-4 Hz) Relative Power in the Scale EEG During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the percent of total power in the delta band over the sum of total power between 0.5 - 70Hz.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Theta Band (4-8 Hz) Relative Power in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the percent of total power in the theta band over the sum of total power between 0.5 - 70Hz.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Alpha Band (8-13 Hz) Power in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the percent of total power in the alpha band over the sum of total power between 0.5 - 70Hz.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Beta Band (13-20 Hz) Relative Power in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the percent of total power in the beta band over the sum of total power between 0.5 - 70Hz.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Anterior-Posterior Functional Connectivity in the Scalp During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the coherence measure, which is used for tracking changes in anterior-posterior functional connectivity. Coherence is a measure of synchronization between two signals which is used to measure anterior-posterior functional connectivity. Coherence is a unitless measure between 0 and 1. High coherence between time-series of two neural populations reflects higher efficiency in communication between those populations and therefore stronger functional connectivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Anterior-Posterior Phase-lag in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Phase-lag was assessed using the Phase-Lag Index (PLI), a measure ranging from 0 - 1. A consistent phase-lag between two tim-series results in a PLI of 1. A time-series without coupling results in a PLI near or equaling 0. Results show the difference in anterior-posterior PLI between baseline and post-ECT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EEG Entropy in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as permutation entropy (PE) measures in posterior regions, which we are using to track changes in scalp EEG entropy. Permutation Entropy (PE) is a measure that is used to quantify the complexity of time series signals. It is a unitless measure between 0 and 1. Lower the PE represents a more regular and more deterministic time series while higher PE represents a more complex time series.

arm_group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered.

intervention.description: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.
Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment resistant depression requiring outpatient ECT
- Planned right unilateral ECT stimulation
- English speaking
- Able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known brain lesion or neurological illness that causes cognitive impairment
- Schizophrenia
- Schizoaffective disorder
- Blindness or deafness or motor impediments that may impair performance for cognitive testing battery
- Inadequate ECT seizure duration with etomidate

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 17 patients were enrolled for study participation between May 2016 and July 2018 at Barnes Jewish Hospital in St. Louis, MO.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 14 of 17 participants were randomized. Of those not randomized, 1 participant's treatment course was canceled by clinical staff, 1 participant withdrew consent prior to any study participation, and 1 participant was deemed ineligible.

group.title: Ketamine +ECT, Etomidate + ECT, Ketamine Sham
group.description: Participants first received ECT treatment under Ketamine general anesthesia, then ECT treatment under Etomidate anesthesia, and finally participants received Ketamine general anesthesia with sham ECT. Ketamine+ECT: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine Sham: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered. Etomidate + ECT: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine Sham: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered. Etomidate + ECT: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

participants_list.participants: 1 pt. in this group completed Week 1, but did not begin Week 2 due to withdraw.
1 pt. in this group completed Week 1, but did not begin Week 2 due to cancellation of treatment.

baseline.population: Per the participant flow report, 17 patients were enrolled in study procedures. Only 10 completed the study, per the full protocol, as reported. However, data from 15 participants are eligible for analyses. So, all analyses were done with 15 participants.

group.description: All participants enrolled in study procedures.

outcome.title: Change in Cognitive Function During Recovery: Rate of Recovery
outcome.description: A cognitive test battery was administered at 0, 30, 60, 90, and 120 minutes following return of consciousness after general anesthesia on each treatment day (1-6). The data from each treatment day (1-6) were averaged for analyses. Cognition Test Battery: Psychomotor Vigilance Task (PVT) Digital Symbol Substitution Task (DSST) Motor Praxis Task (MP) Visual Object Learning Task (VOLT) Abstract Matching (AM) Rate of Recovery for this measure is defined as the time (in inverse hours) for participants to return to their baseline performance for each task.
outcome.time_frame: 0, 30, 60, 90, 120 minutes following return of consciousness, assessed on treatment days 1-6.
outcome.population: Participants with cogntive task data complete for the majority of timepoints following return of responsiveness for more than one treatment day were included in analyses. Additional participants were excluded for individual cognitive task measures for being extreme outliers.

group.title: Etomidate + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine Alone
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.

outcome.title: Delirium Incidence and Severity
outcome.description: Assessed using 3D Confusion Assessment Method (CAM). The groups/arms for this outcome are separated by anesthetic regimen; however, due to the crossover design of this study all participants are included in analyses for each group.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately following return of consciousness (t=0) during treatment days 1-6.
outcome.population: All participants (12) who completed both baseline and t=0 delirium assessments on at least one treatment day.

group.title: Ketamine + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

measure.description: Assessed using 3D Confusion Assessment Method (CAM). The groups/arms for this outcome are separated by anesthetic regimen; however, due to the crossover design of this study all participants are included in analyses for each group.
measure.population: All participants (12) who completed both baseline and t=0 delirium assessments on at least one treatment day.

outcome.title: Suicidality
outcome.description: The groups/arms for this outcome are combined as a whole-group analysis due to the crossover design of this study, as pre-specified by the study protocol. Breaking up the analyses into the various arms of the study would change our scientific questions and approach. All participants included in analyses completed all treatments, the various arms for the study vary only in the order in which participants received each treatment. These data show the change in suicidality from baseline to treatment 6 based on the Scale of Suicide Ideation. The measure completed was the Scale of Suicide Ideation. For this study, participants completed the following questions of the questionnaire: wish to live (0 Moderate to Strong, 1 Weak, 2 None) wish to die (0 None, 1 Weak, 2 Moderate to Strong) The total scores range from 0-4. Lower scores indicate high suicide ideation, and high scores indicate low suicide ideation.
outcome.time_frame: assessed at baseline on treatment days 1-6.
outcome.population: 114 Assessments of suicidality were completed across 13 participants on days 1-6. Data reported show the average change in suicidality from baseline to treatment 6 based on the Scale of Suicide Ideation.

measure.population: 114 Assessments of suicidality were completed across 13 participants on days 1-6. Data reported show the average change in suicidality from baseline to treatment 6 based on the Scale of Suicide Ideation.

outcome.title: ECT Seizure Duration
outcome.description: Duration (in seconds) of seizure induced by ECT treatment
outcome.population: These data were not collected from patient ECT procedure records and therefore were not analyzed.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All participants enrolled in study procedures.

measure.title: ECT Seizure Duration
measure.description: Duration (in seconds) of seizure induced by ECT treatment
measure.population: These data were not collected from patient ECT procedure records and therefore were not analyzed.

outcome.title: ECT Electrical Dose
outcome.description: The electrical dose necessary for seizure induction is determined during a dose-charge titration session prior to participant randomization and session 1. These results report the average electrical dose across all participants for the first treatment session during Treatment Week 1. The range for these data is 0 - 100% electrical charge.
outcome.time_frame: First ECT treatment session during Treatment Week 1
outcome.population: Results are shown for all 13 participants who completed at least one treatment session following the dose charge titration session.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All participants enrolled in study procedures.

measure.title: ECT Electrical Dose
measure.description: The electrical dose necessary for seizure induction is determined during a dose-charge titration session prior to participant randomization and session 1. These results report the average electrical dose across all participants for the first treatment session during Treatment Week 1. The range for these data is 0 - 100% electrical charge.
measure.population: Results are shown for all 13 participants who completed at least one treatment session following the dose charge titration session.

outcome.title: Subjective Assessment of Whether ECT Was Performed, Determined by Asking the Patient.
outcome.description: To assess patient blinding of treatment performed, the patient will be asked: "Based on how you feel, did you have ECT today?" Results indicate participants correctly answering the subjective assessment.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 120 minutes after return of responsiveness on treatment days 1-6
outcome.population: The sample analyzed for each group consists of the total number of treatments performed with paired subjective assessments out of 12 participants.

group.title: Etomidate + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine Alone
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.

measure.title: Subjective Assessment of Whether ECT Was Performed, Determined by Asking the Patient.
measure.description: To assess patient blinding of treatment performed, the patient will be asked: "Based on how you feel, did you have ECT today?" Results indicate participants correctly answering the subjective assessment.
measure.population: The sample analyzed for each group consists of the total number of treatments performed with paired subjective assessments out of 12 participants.

outcome.title: Change in Mood Assessed Using the Mood Self-Assessment Manikin
outcome.description: Mood Self-Assessment Manikin (SAM) Scale: 1 (very unpleasant) - 9 (very pleasant). The groups/arms for this outcome are combined as a whole-group analysis due to the Crossover design of this study, as pre-specified by the study protocol. Breaking up the analyses into the various arms of the study would change our scientific questions and approach. Further, any statistical analyses would be underpowered due to low participant numbers in each arm. Thus, the results are combined and reported as a whole group analysis. All participants included in analyses completed all treatments included in the study, the various arms for the study vary only in the order in which participants received each treatment. These data show the change in mood from baseline to treatment 6 based on the SAM. Additionally, data collected at baseline are not dependent on the study group/arm.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and 120 minutes after return of responsiveness, assessed on treatment days 1-6
outcome.population: The average change in SAM score from baseline to t=120 for all sessions across all participants (t=120 - baseline).

group.title: AllParticipants
group.description: All participants enrolled in study procedures.

measure.title: Change in Mood Assessed Using the Mood Self-Assessment Manikin

measure.population: The average change in SAM score from baseline to t=120 for all sessions across all participants (t=120 - baseline).

Breaking up the analyses into the various arms of the study would change our scientific questions and approach. Further, any statistical analyses would be underpowered due to low participant numbers in each arm. Thus, the results are combined and reported as a whole group analysis. All participants included in analyses completed all treatments included in the study, the various arms for the study vary only in the order in which participants received each treatment. These data show the change in mood from baseline to treatment 6 based on the PROMIS-CAT. Additionally, data collected at baseline are not dependent on the study group/arm.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and 120 minutes after return of responsiveness, assessed on treatment days 1-6
outcome.population: All 13 participants who completed the depression PROMS-CAT both before and after treatment (baseline and 120 minutes following return of responsiveness) on at least one treatment day.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All participants enrolled in study procedures.

outcome.title: Change in Delta Band (0.5-4 Hz) Relative Power in the Scale EEG During Recovery
outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the percent of total power in the delta band over the sum of total power between 0.5 - 70Hz.
outcome.population: Participants with EEG data collected at baseline at T0 post-ECT for at least 1 ECT session were included in analyses.

group.title: Etomidate + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine Alone
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.

outcome.title: Change in Anterior-Posterior Functional Connectivity in the Scalp During Recovery
outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the coherence measure, which is used for tracking changes in anterior-posterior functional connectivity. Coherence is a measure of synchronization between two signals which is used to measure anterior-posterior functional connectivity. Coherence is a unitless measure between 0 and 1. High coherence between time-series of two neural populations reflects higher efficiency in communication between those populations and therefore stronger functional connectivity.
outcome.population: Participants with EEG data collected at baseline at T0 post-ECT for at least 1 ECT session were included in analyses.

group.title: Etomidate + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.

measure.title: Change in Anterior-Posterior Functional Connectivity in the Scalp During Recovery
measure.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as the coherence measure, which is used for tracking changes in anterior-posterior functional connectivity. Coherence is a measure of synchronization between two signals which is used to measure anterior-posterior functional connectivity. Coherence is a unitless measure between 0 and 1. High coherence between time-series of two neural populations reflects higher efficiency in communication between those populations and therefore stronger functional connectivity.
measure.population: Participants with EEG data collected at baseline at T0 post-ECT for at least 1 ECT session were included in analyses.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of anterior-posterior functional connectivity (coherence) at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.
Comparison of anterior-posterior functional connectivity (coherence) at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.
Comparison of anterior-posterior functional connectivity (coherence) at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.

outcome.title: Change in Anterior-Posterior Phase-lag in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Phase-lag was assessed using the Phase-Lag Index (PLI), a measure ranging from 0 - 1. A consistent phase-lag between two tim-series results in a PLI of 1. A time-series without coupling results in a PLI near or equaling 0. Results show the difference in anterior-posterior PLI between baseline and post-ECT.

group.title: Etomidate + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

group.title: Ketamine Alone
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered. Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.

measure.title: Change in Anterior-Posterior Phase-lag in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
measure.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Phase-lag was assessed using the Phase-Lag Index (PLI), a measure ranging from 0 - 1. A consistent phase-lag between two tim-series results in a PLI of 1. A time-series without coupling results in a PLI near or equaling 0. Results show the difference in anterior-posterior PLI between baseline and post-ECT.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of anterior-posterior phase-lag (PLI) at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.
Comparison of anterior-posterior phase-lag (PLI) at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.
Comparison of anterior-posterior phase-lag (PLI) at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.

outcome.title: Change in EEG Entropy in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
outcome.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as permutation entropy (PE) measures in posterior regions, which we are using to track changes in scalp EEG entropy. Permutation Entropy (PE) is a measure that is used to quantify the complexity of time series signals. It is a unitless measure between 0 and 1. Lower the PE represents a more regular and more deterministic time series while higher PE represents a more complex time series.
outcome.population: Participants with EEG data collected at baseline at T0 post-ECT for at least 1 ECT session were included in analyses.

group.title: Etomidate + ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

Ketamine: Ketamine will be used to induce general anesthesia with or without subsequent ECT. Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg. Electroconvulsive Therapy: Dose of the ECT charge will be determined during titration session prior to randomization.

Within a single patient, the dose will remain consistent throughout the study and is estimated to be 2 mg/kg.

measure.title: Change in EEG Entropy in the Scalp EEG During Recovery
measure.description: High-density EEG collected during 5-minute epochs of eyes-closed quiet resting at baseline and post-ECT. Results are reported as permutation entropy (PE) measures in posterior regions, which we are using to track changes in scalp EEG entropy. Permutation Entropy (PE) is a measure that is used to quantify the complexity of time series signals. It is a unitless measure between 0 and 1. Lower the PE represents a more regular and more deterministic time series while higher PE represents a more complex time series.
measure.population: Participants with EEG data collected at baseline at T0 post-ECT for at least 1 ECT session were included in analyses.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of EEG Entropy using Permutation Entropy (PE) measures at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.
Comparison of EEG Entropy using Permutation Entropy (PE) measures at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.
Comparison of EEG Entropy using Permutation Entropy (PE) measures at baseline compared to T0 following return of responsiveness.

reported_events.desc: Each group/arm of this crossover study were reported separately. All participants who completed at least 1 treatment session were included in adverse event reporting. Each group contains a total of 15 participants, as each participant completed each arm of the study at least once.

group.title: Ketamine +ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

group.title: Etomidate +ECT
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with etomidate, approximately 0.2 mg/kg (0.1-0.6 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, an ECT charge will be administered at the previously determined therapeutic dose.

group.title: Ketamine Sham
group.description: General anesthesia for ECT will be induced with ketamine, approximately 2 mg/kg (1-2.5 mg/kg). Following application of stimulation electrodes to the patients scalp, no ECT charge will be administered.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
